newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian copper ends down, other base metals steady.
newsitem.headline: Indian copper ends down, other base metals steady.

text.p: Indian copper prices ended down while other base metals were steady in a narrow trading range on Friday, dealers said.
Copper fell 50 rupees to 13,500 rupees per quintal on low demand, dealers said.
Zinc was steady at 7,850 rupees per quintal but the undertone was firm on global trends, dealers said.
Other metals which were steady were tin at 31,600 rupees, nickel at 36,800 rupees per quintal and aluminium at 7,450 rupees per quintal, dealers said.
"Arrivals of the imported metals from ports to the market were poor due to ongoing strike by transport operators," said Sharad Parikh, president of Bombay Metal Exchange.
Truckers are on strike from April 1 to protest the imposition of a service tax and a hike in insurance premia.
